page.title: 04HEDGES & TREES (SQ.5)
page.content:
This area is sparsely populated with no definite village centre. Most houses are of traditional farm style recently renovated, possibly by newcomers. One or two large new houses were observed. Buildings are of red brick; some with wood frames; many with local sandstone bases. Some former farms are now used as transport depots or as builders yards etc. The terrain is extensively cultivated with fields of mixed cereals. Smaller areas nearer to the farm houses are put down to soft fruit and vegetables, some advertising to the public as "Pick Your Own".
The view from high points revealed a surprising amount of tree cover in hedgerows and small copses. The hedgerows are of various trees. The copses are about an acre in size.
